title: @Riot Is the new champ schedule going to be around the same as last year?
body:
Let me first start off and say that there is not a single player out there who gets more hyped about champ reveals/releases than me, My friends say that I'm addicted, literally. All these new mechanics and kits are great, keep it up. But i was just wondering if you guys plan on doing the same thing as last year, where you cram in 5000 champs in the off season, not necessarily a bad thing, if it's offseason, and right now its not.{{item:3151}}   

 I understand that you guys are busy with reworks and things like the juggernaut update, but its about to be 3 patches in a row with no new hints of a new champ coming anytime soon, so I want to know if i'm gonna get an overdose of champs for christmas or my addiction can be healthily fed by a new champ or two to help me get through first semester.

replies.body:
We've shuffled a couple of champion releases around during the middle of this year. Tahm Kench got pulled forward a bit so that he wasn't coming out at the same time as the Bilgewater event (if pieces of content don't have a relationship that means releasing them together makes sense we like to space stuff out a bit). The next champion by contrast's been pushed somewhat, with the benefit that that lets us focus on the juggernaut stuff in 5.16 and then balanced for Worlds in 5.17 and 5.18. Effective outcome of that is that the gap between Tahm and the next champ's going to be longer than average.

As far as said next champ goes too early to really talk any details, and that's something the team working on the champ/the reveal, should do themselves of course. Will say it's not a support or an assassin though (no big surprises there given Bard/Ekko/Tahm I'm sure, but just in case anyone was wondering).

Thank you for replying to my post! Just a quick follow up, since there is a large gap would this ever open the possibility of releasing two champs in a patch? Or having two champs on the pbe at the same time? Not necessarily related but just to make up for lost time? I can understand as to how that could kill the hype from one theoretically and is highly unlikely but is that ever a possibility? Just curious

I don't think we'd want to do two new champ at once, we do like the way people have time to experiment with a champ, learn how to play against it etc, plus the way each champ gets to be at least a brief focus point on release. I'd imagine we'll see some cases of closer releases at times again though, like the shorter gaps between Gnar/Azir and Kalista/Rek'Sai last year.

Okay guys, lets play the game of Rito Guess!

How this game works is that using what a Rioter has given us, we must formulate an idea on what the new champ will be, bonus points to you if you nail it. 

Well, lets start!

Clue 1: It will NOT be an assassin or support, not surprising seeing as Tahm + Bard were released quite early and brought some interesting things into support. No surprise with nobody wanting another Ekko. This means the positions we have open are: JG, Top, and Mid.

The last champ before those three was, Rek'Sai, A JG. Now we might be able to scratch her from the list as there are a good amount of JG's but, that can be said for mid and top also, its just that certain popular champs are played frequently.

Clue 2: Our latest champs have been quite diverse, we've got a FROG OR A FISH demon from Bilgewater!?, a teenage boy from Zaun that can control time, and a chime collecting thing that helps people.

So, out of this we can see that we've got: an animal (demon?), a normal human boy, a celestial god or something, and before that a lizard rock void stuff thing-a-ding. This is a pretty big thing to humans ratio, but theres something that makes it unlikely this is going to be a human.

Clue 3: Prepare to be surprised, okay, we all know rito has cute little teaser quotes they'll share around that we dont even know was a teaser until the champ preview is released 10 days later. I doubt this is a human as you wouldn't be surprised by something normal being brought to a table, like a piece of bread, you'd be surprised if your family brought out a whopping cake. 

So, i'm gonna go with the whole probably a monster idea as nobody really wants more humans, I mean seriously, who wants to play humans when you could play as a small rat with PTSD that slowly kills people with mushrooms? Personally, I believe this might be that whole "ROBOT MANATEEEE" you can spot in all the Creator skins, as that would be quite surprising if it were actually released and not just a joke. 

Welp, time to wait a few months to see if my statements were right!

I think the best place to look for early teasers is the patch notes intro. before Tahm was released, in the PN intro prior they said "we're always striving to ensure you won't be stuck up the river without a paddle. That said, if conventional means don't work, be careful who you call when seeking help; there's all sorts of things out there, preying on the wishes of desperate people. Mope, and you mope alone - laugh, and the world laughs with you. Or so they say.

Boy that was cryptic." My guess is in the upcoming patch notes or the next we'll see another teaser.
